intro: Hieracium rohacsense subsp. pseudarolae, commonly known as the Rohács hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and linear, often lobed leaves that are arranged in a tight cluster. This subspecies is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a rare and endemic plant in its native range.
